pages.title: Threat Levels
pages.text: Every creature has its spot in the food chain, and Threat Levels are the way in which this is represented. $(br2)Threat Levels guide predator-prey relationships, and serve as a rough estimate of the outcome of a fight. Mobs will only hunt mobs lower on the food chain, and will avoid potentially threatening ones.

pages.title: Formula
pages.text: The Threat Level of a given entity is calculated as: $(br2)Sqrt(Max(attack, 4) + Current HP)/2.5 $(br2)Rounded to the nearest value, with an extra point added for any member of a pack. $(br2)Players are the exception, they have a Threat Level of 4 (with extra points for every 3 Hearts)
